transcription: Screw finding your passion. It's the most misunderstood piece of advice that people give all the time They talk about finding your passion as if it's hiding under your pillow or something But the truth is you already know what you're passionate about. I mean seriously you're awake 16 hours a day What the fuck are you doing? What are you spending your time thinking about? What are you talking about? There's probably some activity or idea that dominates most of your thoughts and conversations You probably already spend most of your day doing it Maybe you're just not paying attention to it because you're under some illusion that to be passionate about something you have to benefit from it Somehow the truth is that we often miss what we're passionate about because it's so natural to us that we don't even realize we're doing It we all care about something, but if you have to convince yourself to care about something only because it benefits you well That's not passion. That's prostitution speaking of which
